nodes.label: Chlorobium tepidum (Green sulfur bacterium)
nodes.description: Green sulfur bacterium studied for photosynthesis evolution, source of genomic sequences containing photosynthesis-related genes

nodes.label: Chloroflexus aurantiacus (Green nonsulfur bacterium)
nodes.description: Green nonsulfur bacterium analyzed for early photosynthesis evolution, source of genomic sequences with photosynthetic genes

nodes.label: 31 Photosynthesis-related genes
nodes.description: 31 open reading frames related to bacteriochlorophyll/porphyrin biosynthesis, carotenoid biosynthesis, and photosynthetic electron transfer identified within ~100 kb genomic sequence

nodes.label: Bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis pathway
nodes.description: Biosynthetic pathway for bacteriochlorophyll production, found to evolutionarily predate chlorophyll biosynthesis based on phylogenetic analyses

nodes.label: Carotenoid biosynthesis pathway
nodes.description: Biosynthetic pathway for carotenoid pigments involved in photosynthetic light harvesting and photoprotection

nodes.label: Photosynthetic electron transfer
nodes.description: Electron transport processes in photosynthetic systems, one of the three major categories of photosynthesis-related genes identified

nodes.label: Heliobacteria
nodes.description: Photosynthetic bacterial lineage identified as closest to the last common ancestor of all oxygenic photosynthetic lineages based on phylogenetic analyses

nodes.label: Purple bacteria
nodes.description: Photosynthetic bacterial lineage identified as the earliest emerging phototrophic lineage, challenging previous evolutionary hypotheses

nodes.label: Oxygenic photosynthetic lineages
nodes.description: Photosynthetic organisms that produce oxygen as a byproduct, with heliobacteria identified as closest to their common ancestor

nodes.label: Phylogenetic analyses
nodes.description: Multiple phylogenetic methods used to reconstruct evolutionary relationships among photosynthetic bacteria and determine ancestry patterns

nodes.label: Chlorophyll biosynthesis pathway
nodes.description: Biosynthetic pathway for chlorophyll production, found to evolutionarily postdate bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis, opposing the Granick hypothesis

nodes.label: Granick hypothesis
nodes.description: Previous hypothesis about the evolutionary order of photosynthetic pigment biosynthesis, challenged by findings showing bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis predates chlorophyll biosynthesis

nodes.label: 16S rRNA phylogenetic analysis
nodes.description: Previous phylogenetic approach using 16S ribosomal RNA sequences that suggested different evolutionary relationships than current gene-based analyses

nodes.label: Hsp60/Hsp70 phylogenetic analysis
nodes.description: Previous phylogenetic approach using heat shock protein sequences that suggested green nonsulfur bacteria or heliobacteria as earliest phototrophs

nodes.label: 100 kb genomic sequence region
nodes.description: Approximately 100 kilobase genomic region analyzed containing the 31 photosynthesis-related open reading frames

nodes.label: Porphyrin biosynthesis pathway
nodes.description: Biosynthetic pathway for porphyrin compounds, precursors to photosynthetic pigments, identified among the 31 photosynthesis-related genes

nodes.label: Early evolution of photosynthesis
nodes.description: The evolutionary development of photosynthetic capabilities in early Earth organisms, with new molecular evidence reshaping understanding of lineage emergence and biosynthetic pathway evolution

nodes.label: Last common ancestor of oxygenic photosynthesis
nodes.description: Hypothetical ancestral organism from which all oxygen-producing photosynthetic lineages evolved, with heliobacteria identified as most closely related

edges.label: identifies as closest to oxygenic ancestor
closest relatives according to phylogenetic analysis
